info.title: Victorian Heritage API
info.description:
The Victorian Heritage Database (VHD) is home to the Victorian Heritage Register which lists the State's most significant heritage places, objects and historic shipwrecks protected under the Heritage Act 2017. It's also home to the Victorian Heritage Inventory which lists all known historical archaeological sites in Victoria.

The VHD API is a read only RESTful API accepting only GET requests and returning only HAL formatted JSON responses. 

## Getting Started

Access to the API requires an API Key.

Once you have obtained the API Key, try submitting the following API requests:

Get a list of places:

- https://api.vic.gov.au/vhd/v1/places

Get a list of shipwrecks:

- https://api.vic.gov.au/vhd/v1/shipwrecks

## Authentication & Authorisation
Calls to the API are authenticated using a unique API Key.  Please register at https://developer.vic.gov.au to obtain your own key.

## Availability and Performance
The API is highly available with a target uptime of 99.95%. Target performance m

get.summary: Fetch all information relating to a specific place. Requires a place id number.
Fetch a collection of places  e.g: /places-collection?col[]=1&col[]=2&col[]=3.

parameters.name: col
parameters.description:
Get a collection of places

**Example:**
- `/places-collection?col=1&col=2&col=3.`

get.summary: Retrieve a list of sub categories for a given category.
Use the kw parameter to retrieve an array of suggested words. e.g: /autocomplete?kw=foo

parameters.name: kw
parameters.description:
Keyword search

**Example:**
- `/autocomplete?kw=ag`

parameters.name: dic
parameters.description:
???

**Example:**
- `/autocomplete?dic=??`

get.summary: Fetch all information for a specific shipwreck.
Access this endpoint to retrieve the full paginated list of recommended tours.
Retrieve a collection of shipwrecks.

parameters.name: col
parameters.description:
Get a collection of places

**Example:**
- `/places-collection?col=1&col=2&col=3.`

get.summary: Retrieve a list of categories
Get the list of available 5 year periods for year built.
Access this endpoint with a Tour ID to retrieve the full information about a specific tour.
Get the complete list of ship propulsion types
Get the list of available primary themes.

Get the complete list of Heritage Authorities, to fetch only those Heritage Authorities that have records pass in the 'hasListings' parameter with a trueish value. (/heritage-authorities?hasListings=true)
Get the list of available 5 year periods
Get the full list of available construction materials.
Get the complete list of heritage act categories
Get the list of primary uses for shipwrecks
Get the list of available architects
Fetch the paginated list of shipwrecks.

parameters.name: rpp
parameters.description:
Records per page (default 25). Change the number of records per page.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?rpp=10`

parameters.name: kw
parameters.description:
Keyword search

**Example:**
- `/autocomplete?kw=ag`

parameters.name: kwt
parameters.description:
Keyword search typ. Used conjunction with keyword search to define the search as either one(at least one of the words), all(all words, any order) or exact(exact match).

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?kw=some+keywords&kwt=one`

parameters.name: kwe
parameters.description:
Words to exclude from keyword search.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?kw=some+keywords&kwe=words+to+exclude`

parameters.name: nme
parameters.description:
Ship name, case insensitive.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?nme=agnes`

parameters.name: num
parameters.description:
Official ship number.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?num=152168`

parameters.name: ll
parameters.description:
Location lost.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?ll=port+arthur`

parameters.name: yb_min
parameters.description:
Year built minimum, use in conjunction with yb_max to form a range.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?yb_min=1885`

parameters.name: yb_max
parameters.description:
Year built maximum, use in conjunction with yb_min to form a range.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?yb_max=1910`

parameters.name: yl_min
parameters.description:
Year lost minimum, use in conjunction with yl_max to form a range.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?yl_min=1885`

parameters.name: yl_max
parameters.description:
Year lost maximum, use in conjunction with yl_min to form a range.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?yl_max=1910`

parameters.name: dpp
parameters.description:
Departure port.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?dpp=sydney`

parameters.name: dsp
parameters.description:
Destination port.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?dsp=melbourne`

parameters.name: pc
parameters.description:
Passenger and crew names.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?pc=McMillen`

parameters.name: cgo
parameters.description:
Cargo description.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?cgo=timber`

parameters.name: plb
parameters.description:
Place the ship was built.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?plb=hobart+tasmania`

parameters.name: plr
parameters.description:
Place the ship was registered.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?plr=hobart+tasmania`

parameters.name: pro
parameters.description:
Propulsion type. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of propulsion types can be retrieved from the /ship-propulsions API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?pro=3`

parameters.name: rig
parameters.description:
Rig. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of rig types can be retrieved from the /ship-rigs API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?rig=3`

parameters.name: vup
parameters.description:
Primary vessel usage. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of options can be retrieved from the /ship-primary-uses API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?vup=2`

parameters.name: vus
parameters.description:
Secondary vessel usage. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of options can be retrieved from the /ship-secondary-uses API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?vus=4`

parameters.name: cm
parameters.description:
Construction material. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of options can be retrieved from the /ship-construction-materials API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?cm=2`

parameters.name: pco
parameters.description:
Period the ship was constructed. Numerical ID. The ID's and year ranges can be retrieved from the /ship-periods-built API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?pco=3`

parameters.name: pl
parameters.description:
Period the ship was lost. Numerical ID. The ID's and year ranges can be retrieved from the /ship-periods-lost API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?pl=2`

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort results by name ascending or name descending (az or za). Send empty sort value to reset to default relevance sorting.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?sort=az`

get.summary: Fetch the list of available municipalities.
Get the list of sub-themes for a given primary theme.
Get the list of available rig types
Get the complete list of architectural styles
Get the list of secondary uses for shipwrecks
Retrieve paginated collection of VHD places.

parameters.name: rpp
parameters.description:
Records per page (default 25). Change the number of records per page.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?rpp=10`

parameters.name: kw
parameters.description:
Keyword search

**Example:**
- `/autocomplete?kw=ag`

parameters.name: kwt
parameters.description:
Keyword search typ. Used conjunction with keyword search to define the search as either one(at least one of the words), all(all words, any order) or exact(exact match).

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?kw=some+keywords&kwt=one`

parameters.name: kwe
parameters.description:
Words to exclude from keyword search.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?kw=some+keywords&kwe=words+to+exclude`

parameters.name: aut
parameters.description:
Heritage authority. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of heritage authorities can be retrieved from the /heritage-authorities API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/places?aut=2`

parameters.name: sub
parameters.description:
Suburb.

**Example:**
- `/places?sub=glenlyon`

parameters.name: str
parameters.description:
Street.

**Example:**
- `/places?str=brunswick+street`

parameters.name: mun
parameters.description:
Municipality. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of municipalities can be retrieved from the /municipalities API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/places?mun=4`

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description:
Postcode.

**Example:**
- `/places?pos=3056`

parameters.name: add
parameters.description:
Municipality. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of municipalities can be retrieved from the /municipalities API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/places?add=39+nicholson+street+abbotsford+yarra_city`

parameters.name: arc
parameters.description:
Architect.

**Example:**
- `/places?arc=davidson`

parameters.name: arcs
parameters.description:
Architectural Style. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of architectural styles can be retrieved from the /architectural-styles API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/places?arcs=3`

parameters.name: yc_min
parameters.description:
Year of construction minimum. Use in conjunction with yc_max to form a range.

**Example:**
- `/places?yc_min=1890`

parameters.name: yc_max
parameters.description:
Year of construction maximum. Use in conjunction with yc_min to form a range.

**Example:**
- `/places?yc_max=1920`

parameters.name: tp
parameters.description:
Primary theme. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of themes can be retrieved from the /themes API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/places?tp=2`

parameters.name: ts
parameters.description:
Secondary theme. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of secondary themes are a property of individual primary themes and can be fetched at the /themes/<theme_id> API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/places?ts=4`

parameters.name: cp
parameters.description:
Primary category. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of primary categories can be retrieved from the /categories API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/places?cp=4`

parameters.name: cs
parameters.description:
Secondary category. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of secondary categories are a property of individual primary categories and can be fetched at the /categories/<category_id> API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/places?cs=2`

parameters.name: cat
parameters.description:
Heritage act categories. Numerical ID. The ID's and names of heritage act categories can be retrieved from the /heritage-act-categories API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/places?cat=3`

parameters.name: per
parameters.description:
Time period. Numerical ID. The ID's and year ranges of time periods can be retrieved from the /periods API endpoint.

**Example:**
- `/places?per=4`

parameters.name: nme
parameters.description:
Ship name, case insensitive.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?nme=agnes`

parameters.name: nmf
parameters.description:
Former name.

**Example:**
- `/places?nmf=the+grange`

parameters.name: his
parameters.description:
History. Keyword search on the historical information of a place.

**Example:**
- `/places?his=some+keywords`

parameters.name: idn
parameters.description:
Unique numbers assigned to each place/object e.g H0001 (VHR Number), H7121-0003 (Heritage Inventory No) or HO123. Local heritage places on the Heritage Overlay (HO) - use the prefix HO.

**Example:**
- `/places?idn=H1522`

parameters.name: geo
parameters.description:
Get all places within a given radius of a geographic location point. Format is lat,lon,distance.

**Example:**
- `/places?geo=-37.803030,145.004620,1`

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort results by name ascending or name descending (az or za). Send empty sort value to reset to default relevance sorting.

**Example:**
- `/shipwrecks?sort=az`

parameters.name: collapse
parameters.description:
Occasionally places will have multiple records under different heritage authorities. Use this parameter to force records to be collapsed under a primary record or listed individually.

**Example:**
- `/places?collapse=true`

get.summary: Get the list of available 5 year periods for date lost.

sw_image_image_id.description: The image id for an image from a random record for this period. (can be null)
